item.title: How to set up SSH with key-based authentication
item.description: SSH is a service used to connect remotely from one machine to another. It is used on pretty much all operating systems except Windows. In this example, I use two machines. The workstation is the machine we are connecting from and the server is the machine we are connecting to. First off, make sure SSH (ssh, ssh-keygen) is installed. Since I use Arch Linux it’s already there by default. A quick search yields this site with instructions for Ubuntu.
